channel.title: Stuxnet
channel.description:
Stuxnet is a Windows-specific computer worm first discovered in June 2010 by VirusBlokAda, a security firm based in Belarus. It is the first discovered worm that spies on and reprograms industrial systems.[1] It was specifically written to attack Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) systems used to control and monitor industrial processes.[2] Stuxnet includes the capability to reprogram the programmable logic controllers (PLCs) and hide the changes.[3] It is the first-ever computer worm to include a PLC rootkit.[4] It is also believed to be the first worm to target critical industrial infrastructure.[5] Furthermore the worm's probable target has been said to have been high value infrastructures in Iran using Siemens control systems.[6][7] It has also been said that the infestation by this worm might have delayed the start up of Iran's Bushehr nuclear power plant.[8] European digital security company Kaspersky Labs released a statement that described Stuxnet as "a working and fearsome prototype of a cyber-weapon that will lead to the creation of a new arms race in the world." Kevin Hogan, Senior Director of Security Response at Symantec, noted that 60 percent of the infected computers worldwide were in Iran, suggesting its industrial plants were the target.[9] Kaspersky Labs concluded that the attacks could only have been conducted "with nation-state support", making Iran the first target of real cyber warfare.[10][11][12]
source: http://wikipedia.org I'm still surprised no one has yet to open a topic about this a virus that is targeted at sabotage rather than money seems to me that we're on the verge of e-warfare. Check out this site as well for a bit more technical look at the worm: http://www.langner.com/en/index.htm Also a friendly walkthrough of one of the exploit it uses to install itself http://compufreaks.blogspot.com/2010/07/microsoft-windows-shortcut-lnkpif-files.html http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/41732 Looking at it with and without protection http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1UxN7WJFTVg

no one ever runs any type of mission-critical software on windows
[/quote]

What the fuck?[/quote]

Maybe I should clarify, no one with a brain.

item.title: Stuxnet
item.dc:creator: @Hyjall Hyjall
item.description:
@Hyjall wrote:

Stuxnet is a Windows-specific computer worm first discovered in June 2010 by VirusBlokAda, a security firm based in Belarus. It is the first discovered worm that spies on and reprograms industrial systems.[1] It was specifically written to attack Supervisory Control And Data Acquisition (SCADA) systems used to control and monitor industrial processes.[2] Stuxnet includes the capability to reprogram the programmable logic controllers (PLCs) and hide the changes.[3]

It is the first-ever computer worm to include a PLC rootkit.[4] It is also believed to be the first worm to target critical industrial infrastructure.[5] Furthermore the worm’s probable target has been said to have been high value infrastructures in Iran using Siemens control systems.[6][7] It has also been said that the infestation by this worm might have delayed the start up of Iran’s Bushehr nuclear power plant.[8]

European digital security company Kaspersky Labs released a statement that described Stuxnet as “a working and fearsome prototype of a cyber-weapon that will lead to the creation of a new arms race in the world.” Kevin Hogan, Senior Director of Security Response at Symantec, noted that 60 percent of the infected computers worldwide were in Iran, suggesting its industrial plants were the target.[9] Kaspersky Labs concluded that the attacks could only have been conducted “with nation-state support”, making Iran the first target of real cyber warfare.[10][11][12]

source: http://wikipedia.org

I’m still surprised no one has yet to open a topic about this a virus that is targeted at sabotage rather than money seems to me that we’re on the verge of e-warfare. Check out this site as well for a bit more technical look at the worm: http://www.langner.com/en/index.htm

Also a friendly walkthrough of one of the exploit it uses to install itself

securityhunk.in

Microsoft Windows Shortcut 'LNK/PIF' Files Automatic File Execution...

Well it is always advisable to use an up-to-date  OS and patch the OS with the available update files,if you donot do that then some person ...


http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/41732
